FuncDef:
The remote-ipv6 command sets a remote address of a DS-Lite tunnel.
The undo remote-ipv6 command deletes a remote address of a DS-Lite tunnel.
No remote address of a DS-Lite tunnel is configured by default.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a remote IPv6 address of a DS-Lite tunnel.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the remote IPv6 address prefix of a DS-Lite tunnel.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A CPE and a DS-Lite device use a local IPv6 address and a remote IPv6 address to create a DS-Lite tunnel. To set a remote address of a DS-Lite tunnel, run the remote-ipv6 command.
Configuration Impact
The DS-Lite device forwards IPv6 packets destined for an IPv6 address configured using the local-ipv6 command to a service board for processing. If the source IPv6 address carried in packets is different from the IPv6 address configured using the remote-ipv6 command, the device discards the packets. If the source IPv6 address is the same as the configured remote IPv6 address, the device performs DS-Lite for the packet.
Precautions
A maximum of 16 remote IPv6 network addresses can be configured in each DS-Lite instance and must be different from interface IP addresses.
Remote addresses of one network segment can be configured only for one DS-Lite instance.
